item.description:
We're really excited to announce that we are starting up a monthly video screening in Nashua - on the 1st Tuesday of every month. We'll have screenings every Tuesday somewhere in the Merrimack Valley: 1st Tuesday-Nashua; 2nd Tuesday-Manchester; 3rd Tuesday-Concord; 4th Tuesday-Northerly (hopefully Plymouth - maybe Campton). If there's a 5th Tuesday in a month, maybe we'll have a Truth Party somewhere!

We have several videos that are fairly current to show and may take a poll on this site to see which one you'd like to see. This week, since we aren't giving you much advance notice, we may just have a chat and planning session. We'll be testing out the video equipment and the wi-fi network. If all works well, we can share our favorite YouTube videos, or if there's time and interest, show an entire DVD.

We'll also go over how each attender can become more involved and spread the workload of running a meetup like this.

We'll have some free DVD's and everyone should bring their collection for trading, viewing, copying, etc. Bring your favorite books, too. We'll develop a collection of books for sale at these meetings.

------------------------------------------------
Please arrive at 6:30 if you can, in order to get your dinner and beverage orders in. The owner has offered us all a 10% discount off of everything on the menu and I hope he'll be able to join us for the videos. We'll start a brief business meeting at 7 and then on to the equipment setups and video showings.

Parking is on West Hollis Street, also across the street in the Nashua City Hall side parking lot and around the block in a lot that is behind the 603. I'll give directions on how you get into that lot when I figure it out.

------------------------------------------------
Merrimack Valley 911 Truth has set up a "carpooling group" online at eRideShare.com. Carpooling arrangements can now be made by clicking on the link above to go to the online ridesharing group. It may take a little getting used to, but now that gas has gone over $3.90, it gets more interesting.

What you will have to do is set up an individual username & password on eRideShare.com. Then, our group nickname is "mv911t" and our password is "truth". Once you've figured out how the system works, just bookmark http://mv911t.eridesh... and remember the password is "truth". Then you can post if you are driving to one of our events and have extra seats - if you're looking for a ride to an event just logon and post that you're seeking a ride.

As always, donations for the ride-sharing are always appreciated to cover gas costs.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll greet everyone - I'm the guy on the left in the picture.
item.name: Nashua monthly video screening & planning meeting
